job_details.Functieomschrijving:
We are looking for a Network Specialist to join our Data Center Engineering and Network Technology team dedicated to providing a reliable foundation for our services and the platform. Reporting to the Engineering Manager, you will work in close partnership with your team, the wider DevOps team and the Engineering department you will help us break down language barriers.

   In this role, you and the other team members will have primary responsibility for operating our Data Centers' Network using modern DevOps tools, automation and classic administration methods.

   You will be responsible for hardware, network operating systems and services that we provide in a growing environment. You will work (remotely) on our production services as well as our high-performance machine-learning clusters in multiple sites. Your work will involve coordinating staff on-site, and you will be able to visit the sites from time to time.

   You will join a team of broadly skilled engineers who will be able to support and kick-start your projects.

   Your responsibilities

     * Configure, maintain and monitor the network environment using our automation stack
     * Maintain, improve and extend our automation stack (Golang, Templating)
     * Contribute to the ongoing renewal and optimization of our sites according to our architectural plans
     * Troubleshooting physical and logical networking issues on routers, switches and Linux hosts
     * Working with multiple hardware vendors and a world-class, high-performance environment
     * Coordinate the work of remote hands in our Data Centers
     * For more complex tasks, you may travel to the data centers to work on-site
     * Collaborate with team members on larger work
     * After sufficient training, you will be part of our 24/7 on-call rotation (paid extra), Diverse and internationally distributed team: joining our team means becoming part of a large, global community with people of more than 90 nationalities. We're more than just colleagues; we're a group of professionals with a shared mission to connect diverse cultures. Our global presence is growing-we've doubled in size nearly every year, with our employees based in the UK, Germany, the Netherlands, Poland, the US, and Japan, and we continue to expand our network.

     * Open communication, regular feedback: as a language-focused company, we value the importance of clear, honest communication. We value smooth collaboration, direct and actionable feedback, and believe that leading with empathy makes us better together.

     * Remote work, flexible hours: whether you're near or in our hubs in cities like Cologne, Berlin, Amsterdam, London, or prefer the comfort of your own home, you decide where your office is. We offer remote opportunities, flexible working hours, including on-call shifts to meet urgent needs and project requirements, and trust in your productivity, all in sync with your team's general locations and time zones to foster effective and seamless collaboration. Our aim is to integrate your work with your lifestyle, ensuring a balance that respects both your needs and our operational requirements.

     * Regular in-person team events: we bond over vibrant events that are as unique as our team, from local team and business unit gatherings, to new-joiner onboardings, to company-wide events that bring us all together-literally.

     * Monthly full-day hacking sessions: every month, we have Hack Fridays, where you can spend your time diving into a project you're passionate about and get the opportunity to work with other teams-we value your initiatives, impact, and creativity.

     * Comprehensive health insurance: your health comes first. With our comprehensive insurance, we'll make sure you're covered from head to toe.

     * 30 days of annual leave: we value your peace of mind. With 30 days off (excluding public holidays) and access to mental health resources, we make sure you're as strong mentally as you are professionally.

     * Annual learning budget: because we never stop learning, we've set up an annual budget for your professional development-pick a learning path which contributes to your career development and we'll back you up.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on network engineering, data center operations, and traditional system administration. While it mentions 'machine-learning clusters', the core responsibilities and technologies described do not align with the specialized tasks of an ML Engineer or GenAI Engineer.

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'dedicated to providing a reliable foundation for our services and the platform' and 'help us break down language barriers' suggests an understanding of how the network supports business functions and potentially a broader company mission, though not deeply detailed.

The mention of 'automation stack (Golang, Templating)' and 'modern DevOps tools' implies software development for automation and infrastructure management, which is a component of software development, albeit focused on infrastructure.

The core responsibilities revolve around 'operating our Data Centers' Network using modern DevOps tools, automation and classic administration methods', 'Configure, maintain and monitor the network environment', and 'Troubleshooting physical and logical networking issues', which are all central to operations engineering, specifically in a network context.
